page.title: 19THE LAST BATTLE IN ENGLAND
page.content: In the 1830s at a time of much discontent and illiteracy amongst the farm workers of this area,a madman and religious fanatic named Thomas Courtenay came from Devon.Staying with a farmer at Fairbrook Farm,Dunkirk, he rode in flamboyant clothes amongst the working people encouraging them to rise against their misery. A confrontation finally took place in Bossenden Woods.A constable,one Nicholas Mears, was murdered whilst attempting to issue a warrant for his arrest.The military were called out from Canterbury.A fantastic battle was fought ending with a bayonet charge. Courtenay and six of his men were killed. Consequently the area of Dunkirk was civilised by the building of a church and school which stand to this day.
